content:
Diagnosis
	1. Gallbladder adenocarcinoma T4N2M1, MMR deficient
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Diagnostic laparoscopy and biopsy only - unresectable disease

	Chemotherapy
	1. GEMCIS - 2 cycles Jan-Feb 2024
	2. Pembrolizumab monotherapy commenced March 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with deteriorating clinical status

	Current issues
	1. Progressive jaundice
	2. Increasing abdominal pain
	3. Marked weight loss
	4. Fatigue WHO PS 3

	Summary of consultation

I reviewed [redacted name] today who attended with her husband. Unfortunately, she has experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past three weeks. Her jaundice has deepened with bilirubin now at 285 μmol/L compared to 156 μmol/L three weeks ago. She reports worsening right upper quadrant and epigastric pain requiring increased opioid analgesia, and her appetite has significantly declined with 4kg further weight loss.

CT imaging performed yesterday shows marked progression of disease with increasing size of the primary gallbladder mass now measuring 8.2cm (previously 6.5cm), new and enlarging peritoneal deposits, and progressive liver metastases with associated biliary obstruction. There are also new pulmonary nodules.

She has only managed two cycles of GEMCIS earlier this year with significant toxicity including grade 3 neutropenia requiring GCSF support. She commenced pembrolizumab in March 2024 given MMR deficient status but has unfortunately shown primary resistance with clear progression.

On examination today, she is markedly jaundiced with tender hepatomegaly and moderate ascites. Her performance status has declined to WHO PS 3, spending >50% of time in bed.

	Further investigations
	1. Urgent ERCP referral made today
	2. Ascitic tap for symptom relief to be arranged

	Medication changes
	1. Increased MST to 30mg BD
	2. Added metoclopramide 10mg TDS

	Follow up
	1. Urgent palliative care review arranged for tomorrow
	2. Discontinuing pembrolizumab given clear progression
	3. Will review next week after ERCP

	Required GP actions
	1. Please monitor renal function given deteriorating status
	2. District nurse referral made for support with increasing care needs
